$eref.description: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc. Schema.org: http://schema.org/CreativeWork

___dateModified.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified.

___alternativeHeadline.description: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

___inLanguage.description: The language of the content. please use one of the language codes from the IETF BCP 47 standard.

___interactivityType.description: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

___copyrightYear.description: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

___creator.description: The creator/author of this CreativeWork or UserComments. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

___publisher.description: The publisher of the creative work.

___about.description: The subject matter of the content.

___sourceOrganization.description: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

___aggregateRating.description: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

___text.description: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

___mention.description: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

___award.description: Awards won by this person or for this creative work. (legacy spelling; see singular form, award)

___educationalUse.description: he purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

___dateCreated.description: The date on which the CreativeWork was created.

___provider.description: The organization or agency that is providing the service.

___keywords.description: The keywords/tags used to describe this content.

___isBasedOnUrl.description: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html

___author.description: The author of this content. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the reltag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

___isFamilyFriendly.description: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

___editor.description: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

___timeRequired.description: Approximate or typical time it takes to work with or through this learning resource for the typical intended target audience, e.g. P30M, P1H25M.

___contributor.description: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork.

___citation.description: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc. NOTE: Candidate for promotion to ScholarlyArticle.

___copyrightHolder.description: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

___review.description: Reviews of the item (legacy spelling; see singular form, review).

___discussionUrl.description: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

___accountablePerson.description: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

___interactionCount.description: A count of a specific user interactions with this item—for example, 20 UserLikes, 5 UserComments, or 300 UserDownloads. The user interaction type should be one of the sub types of UserInteraction.

___typicalAgeRange.description: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

___thumbnailUrl.description: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

___associatedMedia.description: The media objects that encode this creative work. This property is a synonym for encodings.

___contentRating.description: Official rating of a piece of content—for example,'MPAA PG-13'.

description: An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all. Schema.org: http://schema.org/Article

___articleSection.description: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.

___pageStart.description: The page on which the work starts; for example '138' or 'xvi'.

___pagination.description: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, '1-6, 9, 55' or '10-12, 46-49'.

___wordCount.description: The number of words in the text of the Article.

___pageEnd.description: The page on which the work ends; for example '138' or 'xvi'.

___articleBody.description: The actual body of the article.
